'''Roselia''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ロゼリア''' ''Roselia'') is a dual-type {{2t|Grass|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Budew}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]] during the [[Time#Day|day]] and evolves into {{p|Roserade}} when exposed to a [[Shiny Stone]].

==Biology==
Roselia is a small, light green bipedal Pokémon. It has three thorns on top of its head, and it has black eyes with long eyelashes. Visible from the back is a small stretch of yellow coloration around its neck much like a collar. There are leaves extending from its shoulders like epaulettes. It has a leaf skirt with a yellow stripe running down the front. A male will have a shorter skirt than a female. It holds a rose in each of its hands, a red one in its right and a blue one in its left. However, it is said that it will occasionally have unusually colored flowers.

Roselia's aroma brings serenity, but the thorns on its head contain a vicious poison. The more healthy it is, the more pleasant its flowers' aroma. It can lull opponents to sleep using its former [[signature move]], {{m|Grass Whistle}}. It shoots sharp thorns at anything that tries to steal its flowers, and uses different poisons in each hand when it attacks. It lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grassy areas}} where it drinks nutrient-rich spring water.

==In the anime==
[[File:Nando Roselia.png|thumb|left|250px|Roselia in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Drew's Roselia]]====
Roselia debuted in ''[[AG033|Now That's Flower Power!]]'', where one was shown as [[Drew]]'s signature Pokémon. It has been used in many [[Pokémon Contest]]s since. It evolved into {{TP|Drew|Roserade}} at some point between ''[[AG187|The Unbeatable Lightness of Seeing!]]'' and ''[[DP076|A Full Course Tag Battle!]]'', while Drew was in [[Johto]].

====[[Nando's Roselia]]====
[[Nando]] owned a Roselia, which evolved from his {{p|Budew}} in ''[[DP004|Dawn of a New Era!]]'' during a battle against {{Ash}} and his [[Ash's Pikachu|Pikachu]], but Pikachu still won. It later evolved into Roserade at some point prior to ''[[DP176|Coming Full-Festival Circle!]]''.

====Other====
Victoria of the [[Winstrate family]] owns a Roselia, which she used in a battle against {{an|May}} in ''[[AG046|Candid Camerupt]]''.

A Roselia appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M08|Lucario and the Mystery of Mew]]''.

A Roselia appeared in ''[[BW125|Cilan and the Case of the Purrloin Witness!]]'', under the ownership of [[Mr. Shaw]].

A Roselia appeared in ''[[PK27|Pikachu and the Pokémon Music Squad]]''.

===Minor appearances===
A Roselia appeared in ''[[DP086|Arriving in Style!]]'', under the ownership of a [[Pokémon Stylist]]. It was seen competing in the [[Hearthome Collection]].

A Roselia appeared in the opening sequence of ''[[M12|Arceus and the Jewel of Life]]''.

A Roselia appeared in ''[[M16|Genesect and the Legend Awakened]]'' at [[Pokémon Hills]].

A Roselia appeared in ''[[XY002|Lumiose City Pursuit!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Roselia appeared in ''[[XY026|A Battle by Any Other Name!]]'', where it was seen participating in the [[Poké Puff Contest]].

A Trainer's Roselia appeared in ''[[XY059|Under the Pledging Tree!]]''.

A Trainer's Roselia appeared in ''[[XY080|Performing with Fiery Charm!]]''.

A Trainer's Roselia appeared in ''[[XY136|Forming a More Perfect Union!]]''.

===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
{{main|Drew's Roselia}}
[[Drew]] owns a Roselia similar to the anime.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
{{adv|Wally}} caught a Roselia on {{rt|117|Hoenn}} who first appeared in ''[[PS240|Talk About Timing, Treecko]]'', which still remains on his team to this day. Being fairly small, it typically rests on Wally's shoulder and heals Pokémon with its {{m|Aromatherapy}}.

Multiple Roselia appeared in ''[[PS367|Suffering Psyduck]]''.

The Roselia fountain of [[Santalune City]] appeared in ''[[PAXY05|Kangaskhan...Kangascan't]]''.

===In the Pokémon Diamond and Pearl Adventure! manga===
A Trainer's Roselia appeared in ''[[DPA06|Beauty Contest: The Pokémon Super Contest!!]]'', participating in a [[Pokémon Super Contest]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
Roselia appeared in [[PMDP07]] and [[PMDP58]].

==Trivia==
* Roselia is the only Pokémon to receive both {{p|Budew|a pre-evolution}} and {{p|Roserade|an evolution}} in the same generation.
* In 2007, employees of Nintendo of America put [[List of GTS event Pokémon#Heracross|Heracross]] up on the [[Global Terminal|Global Trade Station]] for a Japanese Roselia.
* Roselia is one of fourteen Pokémon that one can collect [[foreign Pokédex entries]] for in {{game|Diamond and Pearl|s}}.
* Roselia and its evolution are the only Poison-type Pokémon belonging in the {{egg3|Fairy}}.

===Origin===
Roselia are based on {{wp|rose|rose bushes}}. Its humanoid design, connection to flowers, and one of its Egg Groups suggest that it is also based on {{wp|fairy|fairies}}.

====Name origin====
Roselia is a combination of ''{{wp|rose}}'' and ''{{wp|azalea}}'' or ''{{wp|buddleia}}''.
